extensionDescription.message: Pretty-prints JSON content in the browser for easy, unobtrusive viewing.

extensionLongDescription.message:
JSONovich pretty-prints JSON content of various types directly in a browser tab. It uses the browser's native JSON parser and a custom-built formatter to produce its output.

Normally, the browser would either prompt to download or display as plain text any JSON sent with the correct application/json mime-type. JSONovich makes working with and debugging output from web services easier by formatting JSON nicely inside the browser.

section.format.text.message: Format documents as JSON by matching a MIME type or file extension. Wildcards aren't supported yet, only exact matches.

section.accept.text.message: Modify the default HTTP $HEADER$ header by matching a URL pattern. Mainly useful for working with CouchDB, has been known to cause conflicts with Confluence, Netflix and the BBC.

pref.debug.text.message: More console messages to help diagnose problems with the addon.

column.mimetype.label.description: Label for the mimetype column. Contains MIME type strings.

column.extension.label.description: Label for the extension column. Contains file extensions.

column.extension.text.message: Matches the part of the filename after the last dot.

column.pattern.label.description: Label for the pattern column. Contains URL match patterns as described at https://developer.mozilla.org/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Match_patterns .

column.pattern.text.message: Matches URLs as described at the linked documentation page.

column.format.label.description: Label for the format column. Shows how the matching entry will be formatted.

column.format.text.message: The type of formatting to perform. Currently this is ignored since the formatter only understands JSON.
column.format.text.description: Description for the format column. Currently this is ignored since the formatter only understands JSON.

column.accept.label.description: Label for the accept column. Contains the list of modifications that will be made to the HTTP Accept header for the matching URL.

column.accept.text.message: The modifications that will be made to the `$HEADER$` HTTP request header.

placeholder.match.format.description: Placeholder for a text input expecting some sort of matcher expression for overriding the default browser handling behaviour.

placeholder.match.accept.description: Placeholder for a text input expecting a URL match pattern for modifying the HTTP Accept header.

action.new.text.message: An entry to be added to the list.

action.add.label.description: Label for an add button. Result is immediate.

action.edit.text.message: Modify the value of the selected item(s).

action.selection.text.message: The number of entries selected in the list.

action.remove.label.description: Label for a remove button. Result is immediate.

action.export.label.description: Label for the export button. User will be prompted with a standard download dialog.

action.export.text.message: Save all preferences for this addon to a file.

action.import.label.description: Label for the import button. User will be prompted with a standard file selection dialog.

action.import.text.message: Select a file whose contents will replace all preferences for this addon.

action.reset.label.description: Label for the reset button. Result is immediate.

action.reset.text.message: Clear all preferences for this addon and restore the defaults, like a fresh install.
